pythonic-fp.queues API¶

Queues Packaage¶

Developer Tools - Queue based data structures

These are modeled after Python builtins. The initializers take at most one iterable while factory functions stand in for Python syntax.

Queue types:

  • class dtools.queues.fifo.FIFOQueue: First-In-First-Out Queue

  • class dtools.queues.lifo.LIFOQueue: Last-In-First-Out Queue

  • class dtools.queues.de.DEQueue: Double-Ended Queue

Create queues from specific values:

  • function dtools.queues.fifo.fifo_queue: Create a FIFOQueue

    • from function’s arguments pushed on in natural FIFO order

  • function dtools.queues.lifo.lifo_queue: Create a LIFOQueue

    • from function’s arguments pushed on in natural LIFO order

  • function dtools.queues.de.de_queue: Create a DEQueue

    • from function’s arguments pushed on from the right

FIFO Queue¶

First-In-Last-Out (FIFO) Queue

class pythonic_fp.queues.fifo.FIFOQueue(*dss)¶

FIFO Queue

  • stateful First-In-First-Out (FIFO) data structure

  • initial data pushed on in natural FIFO order

copy()¶

Return a shallow copy of the FIFOQueue.

Return type:

FIFOQueue[~D]

fold(f, initial=None, /)¶

Reduce with f with an optional initial value.

  • folds in natural FIFO Order (oldest to newest)

  • note that when an initial value is not given then ~L = ~D

  • if iterable empty & no initial value given, return MB()

Return type:

MayBe[T]

map(f, /)¶

Map over the FIFOQueue.

  • map function f over the queue

    • oldest to newest

    • retain original order

  • returns a new instance

Return type:

FIFOQueue[U]

peak_last_in()¶

Peak last data into FIFOQueue.

  • return a maybe monad of the last item pushed to queue

  • does not consume the data

  • if item already popped, return MB()

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

peak_next_out()¶

Peak next data out of FIFOQueue.

  • returns a maybe monad of the next item to be popped from the queue.

  • does not consume it the item

  • returns MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

pop()¶

Pop data from FIFOQueue.

  • pop item off queue, return item in a maybe monad

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

push(*ds)¶

Push data onto FIFOQueue, does not return a value.

Return type:

None

pythonic_fp.queues.fifo.fifo_queue(*ds)¶

Create a FIFOQueue from the arguments.

Return type:

FIFOQueue[D]

LIFO Queue¶

### Last-In-Last-Out (LIFO) Queue

  • stateful LIFO queue data structures with amortized O(1) pushes and pops

  • obtaining length (number of elements) of a queue is an O(1) operation

  • implemented in a “has-a” relationship with a Python list based circular array

  • will resize itself larger as needed

class pythonic_fp.queues.lifo.LIFOQueue(*dss)¶

LIFO Queue.

  • stateful Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) data structure

  • initial data pushed on in natural LIFO order

copy()¶

Return a shallow copy of the LIFOQueue.

Return type:

LIFOQueue[~D]

fold(f, initial=None, /)¶

Reduce with f with an optional initial value.

  • folds in natural LIFO Order (newest to oldest)

  • note that when an initial value is not given then ~T = ~D

  • if iterable empty & no initial value given, return MB()

Return type:

MayBe[T]

map(f, /)¶

Map Over the LIFOQueue.

  • map the function f over the queue

    • newest to oldest

    • retain original order

  • returns a new instance

Return type:

LIFOQueue[U]

peak()¶

Peak next data out of LIFOQueue.

  • return a maybe monad of the next item to be popped from the queue

  • does not consume the item

  • returns MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

pop()¶

Pop data from LIFOQueue.

  • pop item off of queue, return item in a maybe monad

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

push(*ds)¶

Push data onto LIFOQueue, does not return a value.

Return type:

None

pythonic_fp.queues.lifo.lifo_queue(*ds)¶

Create a LIFOQueue from the arguments.

Return type:

LIFOQueue[D]

Double Ended Queue¶

### Double-Ended (DE) Queue

  • stateful DE queue data structures with amortized O(1) pushes and pops each end

  • obtaining length (number of elements) of a queue is an O(1) operation

  • implemented in a “has-a” relationship with a Python list based circular array

  • will resize itself larger as needed

class pythonic_fp.queues.de.DEQueue(*dss)¶

Double Ended Queue

  • stateful Double-Ended (DEQueue) data structure

  • order of initial data retained, as if pushed on from the right

copy()¶

Return a shallow copy of the DEQueue.

Return type:

DEQueue[~D]

foldl(f, initial=None, /)¶

Reduce left to right with f using an optional initial value.

  • note that when an initial value is not given then ~L = ~D

  • if iterable empty & no initial value given, return MB()

  • traditional FP type order given for function f

Return type:

MayBe[L]

foldr(f, initial=None, /)¶

Reduce right to left with f using an optional initial value.

  • note that when an initial value is not given then ~R = ~D

  • if iterable empty & no initial value given, return MB()

  • traditional FP type order given for function f

Return type:

MayBe[R]

map(f, /)¶

Map a function over DEQueue.

  • map the function f over the DEQueue

    • left to right

    • retain original order

  • returns a new instance

Return type:

DEQueue[U]

peakl()¶

Peak left side of DEQueue.

  • return left most value in a maybe monad

  • does not consume the item

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

peakr()¶

Peak right side of DEQueue.

  • return right most value in a maybe monad

  • does not consume the item

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

popl()¶

Pop Data from left side (front) of DEQueue.

  • pop left most item off of queue, return item in a maybe monad

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

popr()¶

Pop Data from right side (rear) of DEQueue.

  • pop right most item off of queue, return item in a maybe monad

  • returns an empty MB() if queue is empty

Return type:

MayBe[~D]

pushl(*ds)¶

Push data onto left side (front) of DEQueue.

Return type:

None

pushr(*ds)¶

Push data onto right side (rear) of DEQueue. Like a Python List, does not return a value.

Return type:

None

pythonic_fp.queues.de.de_queue(*ds)¶

Create a DEQueue from the function arguments.

Return type:

DEQueue[D]
